Issue_Description: Computer will not power on at all. Pressed power button multiple times with no response. Monitor shows no signal. Need urgent help as citizen appointments scheduled today.
Technical_Details: No POST beep. No fan noise. Power LED on motherboard is off. Checked power cable connection - secure. Tried different power outlet - same issue.
Resolution_Notes: Replaced faulty power supply unit. System now boots normally. Verified all services running.

Issue_Title: Excel crashes when opening large files
Issue_Description: Excel 2019 crashes immediately when trying to open files larger than 50MB. Error message: 'Excel has stopped working'. Smaller files open fine. This affects my monthly budget reports.
Technical_Details: Crash occurs during file load. Event Viewer shows Application Error Event ID 1000. Faulting module: EXCEL.EXE. Exception code: 0xc0000005. Tried safe mode - same issue.
Resolution_Notes: Attempting repair installation of Office. User has large external data connections causing memory issues.

Issue_Description: I cannot access the S: drive where all our case files are stored. Getting error 'Network path not found'. Colleagues in same office can access it fine.
Technical_Details: Error code: 0x80070035. Drive mapping shows disconnected red X. Can ping file server successfully (10.1.5.20). Other network resources accessible. VPN not in use - on site.
Resolution_Notes: Drive mapping corrupted. Removed and remapped S: drive to \\fileserver01\social_services. Access restored.

Issue_Description: Entire office has no network connectivity. Cannot access any systems. Internet down. Phone system down. Affecting 45 staff members. All work stopped.
Technical_Details: All workstations show 'No Internet Access'. Cannot ping gateway (192.168.10.1). Switch status LEDs show amber on multiple ports. Main fiber link light is red. Possible ISP issue or switch failure.
Resolution_Notes: Major switch failure. Core switch replaced. All services restored. Some packet loss during transition. ISP confirmed no issues on their end.

Issue_Description: The civil registry application (ZivReg Pro) freezes when searching for records older than 2010. Have to force close and restart. Search for recent records works fine.
Technical_Details: Application becomes unresponsive. CPU usage spikes to 100%. Memory usage normal. Database connection remains active. Log shows query timeout errors after 30 seconds. Database size: 850GB.
Resolution_Notes: Database index corruption suspected. Coordinating with database administrator for maintenance window.

Issue_Description: Received suspicious email claiming to be from director asking to open attached invoice. Email address looks wrong. Subject: 'URGENT: Unpaid Invoice Immediate Action Required'. Did not open attachment.
Technical_Details: Sender: direktor@stadtverwaltungg.de (note extra 'g'). Attachment: Rechnung_2024.pdf.exe (double extension). Email headers show originating IP: 185.220.101.47 (Romania). SPF check failed. Forwarded to security team.
Resolution_Notes: Confirmed phishing attempt. Email quarantined. Sender blacklisted. Security awareness reminder sent to all staff. No compromise detected.

Issue_Description: Office printer (Canon imageRUNNER 2525) prints blank pages. Print job completes successfully according to computer. All pages come out blank. Tried multiple documents and different computers - same issue.
Technical_Details: Printer display shows no errors. Toner level shows 45% black
Operating_System: 60% color. Performed test print from printer menu - also blank. Cleaned print heads via maintenance menu. Paper feeding correctly.
column25: Drum unit depleted despite toner remaining. Replaced drum unit. Test prints successful. Printer returned to service.

Issue_Title: Unable to install CAD software update
Issue_Description: Trying to install AutoCAD 2024 update but getting error 'Insufficient privileges'. I am logged in with my regular account. Need this update to open new project files from contractors.
Technical_Details: Error code: 1603. Installation log shows access denied to C:\Program Files\Autodesk. User account is standard user (not admin). Update requires admin rights. Installation package: AutoCAD_2024.0.1_Update.msi.
Resolution_Notes: Scheduled remote admin session for software installation. Appointment set for tomorrow 14:00.

Issue_Description: My account keeps getting locked every few hours. Have to call helpdesk to unlock. Very disruptive. Changed password yesterday but problem continues. No idea why this is happening.
Technical_Details: Account lockout threshold: 5 failed attempts. Security logs show failed login attempts from IP 192.168.10.234 (not user's workstation). Appears to be service or saved credentials somewhere. User's actual IP: 192.168.10.145.
Resolution_Notes: Found old credential stored in Windows Credential Manager from previous file share. Also mobile device with outdated password. Cleared credentials and updated mobile device. No further lockouts.

Issue_Description: Outlook allows me to send regular emails fine but any email with attachment fails. Error message: 'The operation failed. An object could not be found.' Attachments are normal PDFs and Word docs under 5MB.
Technical_Details: Error occurs immediately when clicking Send. Outlook version 2019 (16.0.10396.20029). PST file size: 8.2GB. Email account type: Exchange. Tested with different file types - all fail. Can receive attachments fine.
Resolution_Notes: PST file corruption. Ran ScanPST.exe repair tool. Minor corruption fixed. Outlook profile rebuilt. Attachment sending now functional.

Issue_Description: Chrome shows security warnings on internal websites. Warning says 'Your connection is not private' with error NET::ERR_CERT_AUTHORITY_INVALID. This started yesterday. Other browsers show same warnings.
Technical_Details: Certificate issued by internal CA. Certificate valid until 2025-06-30. System clock correct. Certificate chain incomplete - intermediate CA cert missing. Other users not reporting similar issues on same sites.
Resolution_Notes: Internal CA root certificate expired on user's machine. Pushed updated root certificate via GPO. Browser cache cleared. All internal sites now accessible without warnings.

Issue_Title: Laptop will not charge - battery critical
Issue_Description: Laptop battery at 3% and will not charge. Power adapter plugged in but charging light not on. Cannot work mobile without power. Have important site inspection this afternoon.
Technical_Details: Battery icon shows 'Plugged in
Operating_System: not charging'. Tested with different power outlet - no change. Power adapter LED is on (green). Checked adapter voltage with multimeter: 19.5V correct. Battery health: 68% design capacity.
column25: DC power jack loose connection. Re-seated connection and verified charging. Battery charging normally. Laptop issued for site visit. Will schedule proper power jack repair next week.

Issue_Description: The DMS (Documentum) is extremely slow today. Takes 2-3 minutes to open documents. Searching takes forever. Multiple colleagues in legal department experiencing same issue. Yesterday it was fast.
Technical_Details: Application response time >120 seconds. Database server CPU at 95%. Multiple long-running queries detected. Transaction log file at 98% capacity. 450 concurrent users (normal: 280). Backup job still running since 03:00.
Resolution_Notes: Database maintenance job hung. Killed stuck backup process. Truncated transaction log. Reindexed database tables. Performance restored. Will investigate backup scheduling issue.

Issue_Description: Wireless mouse cursor is jumping erratically around the screen. Very difficult to click on anything. Tried changing batteries - no improvement. Have upcoming video conference and cannot use computer properly.
Technical_Details: Logitech M720 Triathlon wireless mouse. USB receiver in port on monitor hub. Cursor movement non-linear and random. No other wireless devices nearby. Tried different USB port - slightly better but still problematic.
Resolution_Notes: Wireless interference from newly installed WiFi access point in adjacent office. Moved USB receiver to front USB port using extension cable. Cursor movement now smooth and accurate.

Issue_Description: Cannot remember password for vehicle permits database. Last logged in 3 months ago. Need access to process pending permit applications. Tried usual passwords - all failed. Account not locked yet.
Technical_Details: Application: KFZ-Zulassung Pro. Account: h.krause. Last successful login: 2023-10-12. Password complexity requirements: 12 characters
IP_Address: special character. No self-service reset available for this legacy system.
column28: Verified user identity via phone and employee ID. Reset password via database admin console. Temporary password provided. User successfully logged in and changed to permanent password. Recommended documenting passwords in approved password manager.

Issue_Description: The citizen services application crashed and will not restart. Error message: 'Database connection failed'. Cannot process any citizen requests. Waiting room full of people. Need immediate help!
Technical_Details: Application error log shows: 'Cannot connect to database server db-prod-01.local'. Database server is responsive to ping. SQL Server service running. Network connectivity confirmed. Application server: app-buerger-01.
Resolution_Notes: Database server ran out of available connections due to connection pool leak. Recycled application pool. Cleared orphaned connections. System restored. Will monitor for connection leak issue and patch application.

Issue_Description: Flatbed scanner (Epson Perfection V600) not showing up in Windows. Scan button does nothing. Need to scan building plans for archive. USB cable connected. Scanner power on - green light showing.
Technical_Details: Device Manager shows 'Unknown USB Device (Device Descriptor Request Failed)'. Tried different USB ports - same issue. Scanner worked fine last week. Windows 10 shows USB device connect sound but no driver loads.
Resolution_Notes: USB cable damaged (internal wire break). Replaced USB cable. Scanner detected and drivers installed automatically. Test scan successful. Returned to service.

Issue_Description: Antivirus (Windows Defender) popped up warning: 'Threat detected: Ransom:Win32/StopCrypt.PA'. File was quarantined automatically. Very worried about data security. What should I do? Have not noticed any issues yet.
Technical_Details: Threat detected in: C:\Users\i.meyer\Downloads\Wahlunterlagen_2024.zip. File quarantined at 10:14:32. Full system scan initiated. No encryption activity detected. No other threats found. File downloaded from personal email attachment.
Resolution_Notes: Confirmed ransomware in downloaded file. File remained quarantined. Full system scan clean. No spread detected. Reminded user about email security policy - no personal email on work computer. Security team notified. Incident logged.

Issue_Description: Excel spreadsheet formulas showing as text instead of calculating. All formulas display as the formula itself (=SUM(A1:A10)) rather than the result. This is my monthly sports facility usage report. Never had this problem before.
Technical_Details: Formulas prefixed with apostrophe making them text. Calculation options set to Automatic. F9 key recalculation does nothing. Columns formatted as Text instead of General. Affects only this specific workbook - new workbooks calculate fine.
Resolution_Notes: Cells formatted as Text before formulas entered. Selected all cells and changed format to General. Re-entered formulas. Calculations now working correctly. Showed user how to check cell formatting before entering formulas.

Issue_Description: USB external hard drive with digitized archive documents not showing up. Drive has important scanned historical documents. Drive light is on. Tried multiple computers - none detect it. Makes clicking sound.
Technical_Details: Seagate Backup Plus 4TB external drive. USB 3.0 connection. Clicking sound indicates mechanical failure. Drive not visible in Disk Management. Not assigned drive letter. SMART status unavailable. Last successful backup: 5 days ago.
Resolution_Notes: Hard drive mechanical failure suspected. Data recovery required. Contacted data recovery service. Estimated 3-5 days. Verified last backup available on network storage. User can access backup copy while recovery in progress.

Issue_Description: Remote VPN connection disconnects every 10-15 minutes when working from home. Have to reconnect constantly. Very disruptive during video calls. Started happening after returning from holiday break. Internet connection stable otherwise.
Technical_Details: Cisco AnyConnect VPN client v4.10. Error log shows: 'The VPN connection was terminated by the secure gateway'. Home router: FritzBox 7590. Download: 100Mbps
Operating_System: Upload: 40Mbps. Ping to VPN gateway times out during disconnection. Other household devices stay connected.
column25: Router NAT timeout too aggressive. Instructed user to change NAT session timeout from 300s to 3600s in router settings. Also adjusted VPN keepalive interval. Connection stable for 4 hours test period. Issue resolved.

Issue_Description: Calendar appointments keep disappearing from Outlook. Created meetings yesterday - gone today. Colleagues say they can still see them. Only my view is affected. Very confusing for schedule management.
Technical_Details: Outlook 2019 connected to Exchange Server 2019. Calendar view settings: Work Week. Date range: 2024-01-15 to 2024-01-26. Items visible in OWA (Outlook Web App). Shared calendar permissions: Editor. Cache mode enabled.
Resolution_Notes: Outlook offline cache corruption. Disabled cached mode temporarily. Cleared local OST file. Re-enabled cached mode and forced full resynchronization. All calendar items now visible. Monitoring for recurrence.

Issue_Description: Keyboard on dispatch station #2 completely unresponsive. No key inputs registered. This is backup dispatch station but need functional for emergency coverage. USB keyboard. Tried unplugging/replugging - no change.
Technical_Details: Logitech K120 USB keyboard. Device Manager shows as connected. Num Lock LED not responding. Tested keyboard on different computer - works fine. Other USB devices working on dispatch station. USB port LEDs functioning.
Resolution_Notes: USB port driver failure. Uninstalled and reinstalled USB Root Hub drivers. Keyboard immediately responsive. All keys tested functional. Dispatch station returned to operational status.

Issue_Title: Library catalog search not working properly
Issue_Description: The library catalog system search function returning no results for books I know we have. Searching by title
Technical_Details: author
Operating_System: or ISBN - all return empty. Patrons are complaining. Catalog database was working this morning.
Affected_Software: Software: BiblioCat v7.2. Database: PostgreSQL 12. Search query timeout: 30s. Database server responsive. Can view records by browsing categories. Only search function affected. Error log shows SQL syntax errors in search queries.
Resolution_Notes: No
column26: Recent software update (v7.2.1 applied last night) broke search function. Contacted vendor support. Rollback to v7.2.0 scheduled for tonight during closed hours. Temporary workaround: browse by category.

Issue_Description: The foreign nationals database (AZR-Portal) login failing with error 'Authentication failed'. Checked password multiple times - definitely correct. Colleagues having same issue. Cannot process any applications.
Technical_Details: Web-based application. URL: https://azr-portal.verwaltung.local. Error appears after entering credentials. Browser: Chrome 121. Cleared browser cache - no change. Different browsers tested - same result. Network connectivity confirmed.
Resolution_Notes: Authentication server certificate expired at midnight. Renewed SSL certificate and restarted authentication services. All users can now log in successfully. System restored to full operation. Certificate renewal process review scheduled.

Issue_Title: Webcam not working for online press conference
Issue_Description: Built-in laptop webcam not functioning. Camera app shows black screen. Important online press conference in 2 hours. Microphone works fine. Camera worked last week during test call. Red indicator light does not turn on.
Technical_Details: Dell Latitude 7420 built-in webcam. Device Manager shows 'Integrated Webcam' with yellow exclamation. Error code 43. Driver version 10.0.19041.1. Zoom and Teams both show no camera available. Privacy settings show camera access enabled for apps.
Resolution_Notes: Webcam driver crashed and failed to restart. Uninstalled device from Device Manager. Scanned for hardware changes. Driver reinstalled automatically. Camera functional. Red light activates. Test call successful. Press conference proceeded on schedule.

Issue_Description: Sent email to wrong recipient with confidential business license information. Need to recall the message urgently. Email sent 10 minutes ago. Recipient has not opened it yet according to read receipt. How do I recall?
Technical_Details: Outlook 2019. Email sent to external address (competitor business). Contains sensitive information about another company's application. Recall function attempted but failed - recipient not on same Exchange server. Message read receipt not enabled.
Resolution_Notes: Email recall not possible for external recipients. Contacted email administrator - message still in outbound queue. Successfully deleted from queue before delivery. Crisis averted. Counseled user on checking recipients before sending sensitive information.

Issue_Description: Digital signature pad for marriage certificates not working. When couples sign nothing appears on screen. Pad lights up when touched. Software recognizes pad is connected. Need for wedding ceremony tomorrow morning.
Technical_Details: Wacom STU-540 signature pad. USB connection. Wacom driver version 6.3.45-3. Pressure sensitivity test fails. Calibration utility shows no input. Pen tip moves cursor but no signature captured. Works in Wacom test application but not in civil registry software.
Resolution_Notes: Software compatibility issue with latest Wacom driver update. Rolled back driver to version 6.3.42-1. Signature pad now capturing signatures correctly. Test signatures successful. Device ready for ceremony. Will hold driver at this version pending software update.

Issue_Description: SAP ERP system running extremely slowly this morning. Transaction response times 5-10 minutes. Affects all financial modules. Month-end closing deadline today. Multiple departments reporting same issue. System unusable.
Technical_Details: SAP ERP 6.0 EHP8. Application server CPU: 28% (normal). Database server CPU: 89%. Multiple long-running queries in ST04 transaction. Table BSEG (accounting document segment) extremely large. Last successful backup: completed. Active users: 234.
Resolution_Notes: Database statistics outdated causing poor query performance. Executed database optimization (DB13). Updated table statistics for BSEG and related tables. Performance restored to normal. Response time <3 seconds. Month-end closing proceeding. Regular maintenance schedule needed.

Issue_Title: Cannot open PDF attachments in email
Issue_Description: Outlook emails with PDF attachments won't open. Error: 'This file does not have a program associated with it'. Excel and Word attachments open fine. Only PDFs affected. Need to review health inspection reports sent as PDFs.
Technical_Details: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed. Version 2023.006.20380. PDF files saved to desktop open correctly with Acrobat. Issue only when opening directly from Outlook attachment. File associations appear correct in Windows settings. Other users not experiencing this issue.
Resolution_Notes: Outlook file handler association broken. Repaired Office installation through Control Panel. Reset default file associations for PDF. Registry key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\FileExts\.pdf cleaned. PDF attachments now opening correctly from Outlook.

Issue_Description: Handheld barcode scanner not scanning equipment inventory labels. Red laser visible. Beep sounds on trigger press but no data captured. Need to complete quarterly inventory. Worked fine last quarter.
Technical_Details: Symbol LS2208 barcode scanner. USB connection. Scanner configured for keyboard wedge mode. Scans work in Notepad (data appears as typed text). Does not work in inventory application. Application expecting data in different format.
Resolution_Notes: Scanner output format mismatch. Application expects data with CR/LF suffix. Scanner configured for data only. Reprogrammed scanner with setup barcode to add carriage return/line feed after data. Scanner now populating inventory fields correctly. Inventory proceeding.

Issue_Title: Social services database showing wrong client information
Issue_Description: Client database showing incorrect person data when searching by case number. Search for case #2024-0156 shows data for completely different person. Critical data integrity issue. Cannot process benefits applications until resolved. Multiple case workers affected.
Technical_Details: Database: SQL Server 2019. Application: SozialPlus v6.3. Query returns wrong PersonID for CaseNumber. Database logs show no unauthorized modifications. Recent database migration performed weekend before last. Data validation checksums mismatched.
Resolution_Notes: Critical database index corruption after migration. Database administrators investigating. Temporary workaround: search by client name and verify manually. Full database integrity check running. Estimated resolution time: 6-8 hours. Management escalated.

Issue_Title: GIS software crashing when loading map layers
Issue_Description: ArcGIS Pro crashes when attempting to load traffic planning layers. Error: 'ArcGIS Pro has encountered a serious application error'. Base maps load fine. Only custom layers with traffic data cause crash. Need for traffic analysis report due Friday.
Technical_Details: ArcGIS Pro 3.1. Layer file size: 2.3GB. Memory usage spikes to 15GB then application crashes. Event log shows out of memory exception. System has 16GB RAM. Crash dump file generated. Other GIS projects open successfully without traffic layers.
Resolution_Notes: Layer data exceeds available memory. Attempting to optimize layer by reducing feature density. Also investigating RAM upgrade to 32GB. User advised to work with smaller geographic extents in meantime. Coordinating with GIS administrator for permanent solution.

Issue_Title: Locked out of building access control system
Issue_Description: Cannot log into building access card management system. Need to program access cards for new cultural center staff starting today. System showing 'Access Denied' with my admin credentials. Verified password is correct. Worked yesterday.
Technical_Details: Web-based system: BuildingAccess Pro v4.5. URL: https://access.stadtverwaltung.local. Browser: Firefox 122. Credentials: a.meyer / [verified correct]. Account status in Active Directory: Enabled. No recent policy changes. Error code: 401 Unauthorized.
Resolution_Notes: User account permissions modified accidentally during security group cleanup yesterday. Restored user to 'BuildingAccess_Admins' security group. Access immediately restored. New staff access cards programmed successfully. Permission audit scheduled to prevent recurrence.

Issue_Description: Primary monitor flickering intermittently. Annoying but not preventing work. Flickering increases in frequency throughout day. Monitor: Dell P2422H 24-inch. Connected via DisplayPort. Second monitor on same computer works fine. Started 3 days ago.
Technical_Details: DisplayPort cable connection secure. Monitor OSD menu also flickers (rules out PC issue). Monitor firmware version: M2T104. Tried different DisplayPort cable - flickering persists. Refresh rate: 60Hz. Resolution: 1920x1080. Monitor purchased 18 months ago.
Resolution_Notes: Monitor backlight failing (hardware fault). Under Dell warranty. Opened warranty case. Replacement monitor shipped overnight. Installed and configured replacement. Defective monitor returned to Dell for repair. User satisfied with new monitor.

Issue_Title: Email rules not working after Outlook update
Issue_Description: Outlook email rules stopped working after automatic update yesterday. All my carefully organized folder rules are gone. Inbox getting flooded. Rules still show in settings but not executing. This disrupts my entire workflow.
Technical_Details: Outlook 2019 updated to build 16.0.16924.20150. Rules visible in Rules and Alerts dialog. All rules enabled. Manually running rules works. Automatic execution not triggering. Client-side rules. Mailbox size: 4.2GB. No error messages. Recent items folder showing all unorganized mail.
Resolution_Notes: Known issue with Outlook update build 16.0.16924.20150. Rules processing disabled by bug. Applied hotfix update 16.0.16924.20152. Restarted Outlook. Rules now executing automatically. Manually ran rules on existing inbox items to organize. Microsoft KB article referenced for future issues.

Issue_Title: Parking violations software not printing tickets
Issue_Description: Handheld parking enforcement devices (PDA) not printing violation tickets. Error on device: 'Printer communication error'. Officers cannot issue tickets. Affects 6 devices across district. Started this morning. Tested printer paper - adequate supply.
Technical_Details: Zebra QLn320 mobile printers. Connection: Bluetooth. Device OS: Android 11. Application: ParkControl v3.2. Bluetooth pairing shows connected. Printer status LED: solid green. Test print from printer settings works. Only app printing fails.
Resolution_Notes: Application update pushed overnight with incorrect printer driver reference. Rolled back ParkControl app to v3.1 on all devices. Printing immediately functional. Test tickets printed successfully. Officers back on patrol. Update v3.2.1 with fix to be deployed after testing.

Issue_Description: Dymo label printer producing smudged unreadable labels. Used for file folder labels in registry office. Text completely illegible. Cleaned print head per manual - no improvement. Tried new label roll - same issue.
Technical_Details: Dymo LabelWriter 450 Turbo. USB connection. Driver version: 8.7.4. Print quality: 300 dpi. Test label from Dymo software also smudged. Printer used daily for 3 years. Label type: 30252 Address labels. Thermal printer (no ink/toner).
Resolution_Notes: Thermal print head worn out (end of life). Printer exceeds expected duty cycle. Ordered replacement LabelWriter 550 (newer model). Installed and configured. Test labels crisp and clear. Transferred label templates to new printer. Old printer decommissioned. User training provided on new model features.

Issue_Description: Working on property survey drawing. All layers except base layer disappeared from layer manager. Hours of work potentially lost. File size still shows correct (13.5MB). Tried opening on colleague's computer - same issue. Last saved 30 minutes ago.
Technical_Details: AutoCAD 2024. File format: DWG. File recovery attempted - no autosave newer than problem version. Layer properties manager shows only 'Layer 0'. Undo history exhausted. File backup from network drive: 2 days old. Could lose 2 days of detailed surveying work.
Resolution_Notes: DWG file corruption (partial). Used AutoCAD Recovery Manager. Recovered 14 of 15 layers from backup file fragment. Merged recovered layers with current file. Only minor detail work lost (approximately 30 minutes). File saved with repair. Advised user to save more frequently and enable autosave every 10 minutes.

Issue_Title: Suspicious login attempts on election system
Issue_Description: Security alert email received: Multiple failed login attempts on election management system from unknown IP address. 47 attempts in last 2 hours. Very concerned given upcoming election. Need immediate security assessment. Have not clicked any suspicious links recently.
Technical_Details: System: Wahl-Manager Pro. Failed login account: admin@wahlamt. Source IP: 203.0.113.45 (United States). Login attempts: 09:00-11:00. Account not locked (different usernames tried). Password policy: 8 characters minimum. 2FA not enabled on this legacy system. Firewall logs show connection attempts.
Resolution_Notes: Brute force attack detected. Immediately blocked source IP at firewall. Enabled account lockout policy (5 attempts). Forced password reset for all election system accounts to 16+ character complex passwords. Security audit initiated. 2FA implementation fast-tracked. Law enforcement notified. No breach detected.

Issue_Description: Attempting to import new student enrollment data from Excel. Import wizard fails with error 'Data type mismatch'. Imported successfully last month with same format. Contains 247 new student records. Import must complete before Monday registration.
Technical_Details: Database: Access 2019. Import file: Excel 2019 (.xlsx). Error on column 'Geburtsdatum' (date of birth). Data format: DD.MM.YYYY. Import wizard expecting MM/DD/YYYY. Locale settings: German (Germany). Date format in Windows: DD.MM.YYYY. Excel regional settings: correct.
Resolution_Notes: Access import schema retained US date format from previous database template. Modified import specification to match German date format DD.MM.YYYY. Re-ran import - successful. All 247 records imported correctly. Dates verified. Saved import specification as template for future imports.

Issue_Title: CD/DVD drive not reading archive discs
Issue_Description: Optical drive not reading archive CDs containing digitized historical documents. Drive opens and closes. Discs spin up. No data appears. Error: 'Please insert a disc'. Tried multiple discs known to be good. Drive worked last week.
Technical_Details: HL-DT-ST DVDRAM GUD1N SATA drive. Media: CD-R and DVD-R. Discs readable on other computers. Drive letter: D:. Lens cleaning disc attempted - no improvement. Windows shows drive as working properly. No driver updates available.
Resolution_Notes: Optical drive laser failed (hardware failure). Replacement USB external DVD drive ordered and installed. Archive discs readable on new drive. Test read successful. Mapping drive letter D: to external drive for consistency. Internal drive to be replaced during next scheduled maintenance window if needed.

Issue_Title: Cannot connect to financial network shares
Issue_Description: All network drives (F:
Technical_Details: G:
Operating_System: H:) showing red X. Cannot access any financial documents or shared folders. Other colleagues in same office have access. Rebooted computer - no change. Need access for budget reconciliation meeting in 1 hour.
Affected_Software: Computer can ping file server successfully. DNS resolution working. Other network resources (internet
Hardware_Type: email) accessible. Error when accessing shares: 'Windows cannot access \\fileserver02\finance'. Error code: 0x80070035. Network adapter: Intel I219-LM. Active Directory authentication successful.
Resolution_Notes: No
column27: Computer account in Active Directory lost secure channel. Reset computer account using PowerShell: Reset-ComputerMachinePassword. Rejoined domain. All network shares immediately accessible. Verified file access. User ready for meeting. Documented procedure for faster resolution if recurs.

Issue_Title: Cannot send email to external health organizations
Issue_Description: Emails to external recipients (.de domains outside our organization) fail with bounce-back: 'Delivery has failed'. Internal emails work fine. Only external emails affected. Need to send health inspection reports to state health office urgently. Started this afternoon.
Technical_Details: SMTP error: 550 5.7.1 Unable to relay. Exchange Server 2019. Email size: 2.4MB (below 10MB limit). No attachments with executable extensions. Recipient domain MX records verified functional. Other users can send external email successfully. Only affects this user account.
Resolution_Notes: User account missing from 'External Email Send' security group after recent AD group restructuring. Added user to correct security group. Propagated group membership. External email sending immediately functional. Test email delivered successfully. Inspection reports sent. Reviewed group membership procedures with IT team.

Issue_Description: Main dispatch screen went black during shift change. Computer running - can hear fans. Keyboard lights working. Monitor power light amber. No display whatsoever. This is primary emergency dispatch station. Backup station activated but need primary operational.
Technical_Details: Dell P2722H 27-inch monitor. Connection: DisplayPort. Monitor OSD buttons non-responsive. Power cycled monitor - no change. Tried HDMI cable - no signal. Monitor worked perfectly 10 minutes ago. No power fluctuations reported. Critical infrastructure.
Resolution_Notes: Monitor complete failure. Replaced with spare from storage immediately. Dispatch station operational in 15 minutes. All emergency services resumed on primary station. Defective monitor tested - confirmed dead (power supply failure). New monitor ordered as spare replacement. Minimal impact on emergency operations.

Issue_Title: Case management software showing SQL errors
Issue_Description: Youth services case management system displaying error messages: 'SQL Exception: Transaction deadlock detected'. Error appears randomly when saving case notes. Sometimes save succeeds after retry. Very frustrating and time-consuming. Multiple case workers experiencing this.
Technical_Details: Application: YouthCare Manager v5.6. Database: SQL Server 2019. Error frequency: 3-4 times per hour. Database server CPU: 45%. Memory: 67% used. Concurrent users: 67. Transaction isolation level: Serializable. Deadlock graphs available in SQL Server logs.
Resolution_Notes: Database deadlock issue caused by long-running transactions and lack of proper indexing. DBA analyzing deadlock graphs. Temporary mitigation: increased transaction timeout. Permanent fix requires application code optimization. Vendor contacted for patch. Estimated resolution: 5-7 business days.

Issue_Description: Trying to access historical building permit scans on archive server. Getting 'Access is denied' error. Need permits from 1995-2000 for property research. Have accessed this archive previously without issues. Last accessed 2 months ago.
Technical_Details: Network path: \\archive-srv\building_permits\historical\1990s. NTFS permissions appear unchanged. User member of 'Building_Archive_Readers' group. Group membership confirmed in Active Directory. Can access other folders on same server. Only this specific folder affected.
Resolution_Notes: Folder permissions accidentally modified during file server cleanup last week. 'Building_Archive_Readers' group removed from ACL. Restored correct NTFS permissions. Verified user can access historical folder. Test file open successful. Permission audit log review scheduled to prevent future accidental changes.

Issue_Description: Checkout counter barcode scanner scanning repeatedly without trigger press. Continuous rapid beeping. Cannot scan patron cards or books. Unplugged and replugged - starts immediately scanning again when connected. Disrupting library operations.
Technical_Details: Honeywell Voyager 1202g barcode scanner. USB connection. Scanner in continuous/presentation mode instead of trigger mode. Configuration: factory default. Beep volume: high. Scan rate: continuous. No physical trigger damage visible. Scanner 14 months old.
Resolution_Notes: Scanner inadvertently set to presentation mode (for automatic scanning of items passed in front). Scanned configuration barcode to set manual trigger mode. Beeping stopped. Scanner now activates only when trigger pressed. Tested with books and patron cards - functioning correctly. Provided configuration barcode sheet for future reference.
